subject: Management
title: The Context Switch Tax
description: One-minute skill: The Context Switch Tax.

hook.text: A study found that workers check email 77 times per day. Each check costs 23 minutes of refocus.

buildup.text: Switching between tasks isn't free. Your brain needs time to reload the mental context.

discovery.text: Gloria Mark's research: after an interruption, it takes an average of 23 minutes to fully refocus.

twist.text: You don't feel the cost in the moment. But it accumulates into hours of lost productivity daily.

climax.text: Batch similar tasks. Handle email in two dedicated slots. Minimize the number of context switches.

punchline.text: Every interruption costs 23 minutes. Count them and weep.

quiz.question: How long does it take to refocus after an interruption?
options: An average of 23 minutes according to research
About 2 minutes for most knowledge workers
Interruptions have no measurable effect on focus
